alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Moore; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Hoke, Moore, Richmond and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicates that most of the heavy rain has ended, although additional small pockets of heavy rain are still moving northward over the next hour or so. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Pines, Raeford, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Hoffman, Pinebluff, Foxfire, Wagram, Camp Mackall, Ashley Heights, Bowmore, Sandhills Game Land and Silver City. - This includes the following flood prone locations... US 1 near Aberdeen and Gum Swamp Creek & Dam. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
